column4: why is it that even after disabling my local firewall... local users on my network cannot connect to services running on my machine? They cant even ping me.
I'm trying to host a crack-attack game :)
I did a sudo ufw disable ... to no avail
a good place to test to see if you have your ports properly set is canyouseeme.org
but that would push through my external firewall... which would skew the results
It wouldnt hurt to reboot to refresh the settings

well i know i had similar issues, with my machine being access on the internal network but not the outside one..that was how i tested the ports...also make sure your isp isnt blocking the port on the incoming.
this is all local that I'm talking about
ok sorry.....sorry for late reply trying to think about your problem.
ping doesnt work either way to or from your machine?
do I need to reboot after doing ufw disable ?
only thing i am wondering is are you using a router?
the only thing that changed was installing 9.04 .... works fine on the laptop sitting next to me running 8.10
well cool that narrows it down for sure
good idea, I'm doing an angryipscan from another computer
i wouldnt know ive only been using 9.4 for awhile
